aboutUs.title: Information & Guidelines
aboutUs.subtitle: Everything you need to know about serving at the Kumbh Mela
aboutUs.sevaDescription: Volunteering at the Kumbh Mela is more than just a duty. It is an act of spiritual service and compassion. As a volunteer, you become a vital part of ensuring that every visitor has a memorable, safe, and spiritually enriching experience. Together, we ensure their safety, comfort, and spiritual experience is seamless.
aboutUs.sevaQuote: Volunteers are the backbone of the spiritual events, bridging the gap between the administration and the devotees.
aboutUs.crowdMgmtDesc: Direct visitors, prevent overcrowding at ghats and temples, and ensure orderly queues during peak times.
aboutUs.infoGuideDesc: Assist visitors with directions, schedules, and arrange handicap assistance to ensure comfortable navigation.
aboutUs.medicalDesc: First responder support and coordinating with ambulances to ensure medical emergencies are handled efficiently.
aboutUs.sanitationDesc: Ensuring the holy grounds remain clean and public facilities are hygienic throughout the event.
aboutUs.faq1A: Yes. Basic dormitory-style accommodation and meals (Sarak Bhangi) are provided to all volunteers in designated areas. Hot meals, water, and rest facilities are available throughout your shift.
aboutUs.faq2A: Volunteers must be at least 18 years of age. Special youth batches (17+) are available with parental consent.
aboutUs.faq3A: Yes. All volunteers that assigned leisure will receive an official certificate of service recognizing your contribution to the Mela.
